text: RT @CECCgov #HuangQi will mark his 55th bday in a Chinese detention center.  Founder of a rights website & a citizen journalist, he was charged w/ leaking state secrets & has kidney disease. #Chinese govt has one of the world’s worst records on press freedom. http://ppdcecc.gov/QueryResultsDetail.aspx?PrisonerNum=4053 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DaLorC9V4AAlJLH.jpg

RT @CECCgov Human rights lawyer #WangQuanzhang forcibly disappeared for over 1000 days, denied legal counsel of his own choosing, & reportedly tortured by electric shock. His courageous wife @709liwenzu still seeking answers from #ChineseGovernment. #FreeChinasHeroes. http://ppdcecc.gov/QueryResultsDetail.aspx?PrisonerNum=10937 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DaGnf2jVAAEq3Tu.jpg

.@ICEgov has changed its policy to allow increased detention of pregnant women, despite reports of mistreatment & miscarriages. Pregnant women should be treated with dignity – regardless of their immigration status. This new policy seriously jeopardizes their health & wellbeing. https://twitter.com/thehill/status/982026622093152256 QT @thehill Dems question ICE standards for detaining pregnant women http://thehill.com/homenews/senate/381895-democrats-question-ice-standards-for-detaining-pregnant-women http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DaDcAfYW4AEDbhX.jpg

The @NRA wants you to think any attempt to protect civilians from weapons of war that can slaughter dozens in minutes is somehow unconstitutional. Most Americans know that's ridiculous. Yesterday, a federal court in Massachusetts said so when it upheld our assault weapons ban. https://twitter.com/massago/status/982285142361346048 QT @MassAGO Today’s decision upholding the Assault Weapons Ban vindicates the right of the people of Massachusetts to protect themselves from these weapons of war and our efforts to enforce the law. https://www.mass.gov/news/ags-office-wins-federal-case-defending-assault-weapons-ban-judge-rejects-challenge-by-gun

“You may shoot me with your words,
You may cut me with your eyes,
You may kill me with your hatefulness,
But still, like air, I’ll rise.”

— Maya Angelou 

#NationalPoetryMonth
